title: First Russia, now Iran: Trump announces 25% tariffs on Tehran's trade partners; calls order 'final'
content: US President Donald Trump has imposed a 25% tariff on nations trading with Iran, escalating pressure over Tehran's violent crackdown on protests. Trump warned of severe retaliation if Iran strikes US bases, stating the nation is nearing a red line.

title: Apple-Google AI deal confirmed: Gemini powers Siri; upgrade this year
content: Apple is partnering with Google, leveraging its Gemini AI models to significantly upgrade Siri and future Apple Intelligence features. This move acknowledges Apple's need for advanced AI, a departure from its internal development struggles. The collaboration aims to deliver a more capable assistant, with the revamped Siri expected to launch soon, marking a significant win for Google's AI advancements.

title: 'You can't align what you can't control': Microsoft AI boss warns rivals
content: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman urges the industry to prioritize containment over alignment in AI development, warning against pursuing superintelligence without first ensuring control. He advocates for a "Humanist Superintelligence" approach, focusing on practical applications like medical AI and clean energy, to maintain human oversight and avoid uncontrolled autonomous systems.

title: Apple's Korea hotel gambit failing: Memory costs jump 300%; chipmakers refuse long-term deals
content: Apple executives are in South Korea negotiating memory chip deals amidst soaring prices, up to 300% since mid-2025.  Memory makers are planning aggressive hikes, even charging Samsung's own divisions significantly more.  This AI-driven shortage means less RAM for phones and PCs, with Apple facing tough renegotiations this month.

title: Is Joel Embiid playing vs Raptors tonight? Latest 76ers injury update
content: Joel Embiid did not play for the Philadelphia Sixers against the Toronto Raptors on January 12, 2026. He was sidelined due to left knee injury management and left groin soreness. This absence continued the Sixers' careful approach to his health this season. The team has managed to stay competitive without him, with Tyrese Maxey and Paul George stepping up.

title: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant’s combined net worth after Kobe Bryant
content: Vanessa and Natalia Bryant, following the tragic loss of Kobe Bryant, have amassed a combined net worth of $606 million. Vanessa manages the Mamba & Mambacita Sports Foundation and benefits from brand deals and business ventures. Natalia, a budding model, contributes to her $6 million net worth through her career and inheritance.

title: Travis Kelce’s wedding rule for Taylor Swift raises eyebrows
content: Travis Kelce revealed he is already thinking carefully about his wedding to Taylor Swift, especially the seating chart. Speaking on his podcast, Kelce said he prioritizes guest chemistry and would rather not invite someone than seat them awkwardly. He also shared excitement about introducing Swift as his fiancée to teammates and celebrating their engagement privately.

title: Gisele’s family reportedly still prefers Tom Brady over Joaquim Valente
content: Gisele Bündchen’s family is reportedly uneasy about her marriage to Joaquim Valente, with Tom Brady still serving as a point of comparison. Sources claim relatives worry about financial imbalance and potential prenup loopholes, despite the couple’s happiness and growing family. While Bündchen appears confident in her choice, those closest to her remain cautious about long term security.

title: T20 World Cup row: B'desh matches to stay in India; security risk 'low', says ICC source
content: The ICC has dismissed claims by Bangladesh’s sports adviser that security concerns could bar Bangladesh from travelling to India for the 2026 T20 World Cup, stating its independent risk assessments rate the threat level as low to moderate and fully manageable

title: Gurgaon: Coach 'rapes' minor at stadium bathroom; pregnancy led to complaint
content: A junior hockey coach in Gurgaon has been arrested. He is accused of raping a minor student four months ago. The student, a Class 12 player, reported the incident after becoming pregnant. She suffered a miscarriage. The coach is in police custody for questioning. Investigations are ongoing.

title: 'We'll hit them ...': Trump on Iran's threat to target US bases; over 500 killed in protests
content: US President Donald Trump stated Washington is monitoring Iran's deadly protests and considering military retaliation, warning of unprecedented strikes if attacked. Iran's President accused the US and Israel of fomenting unrest, while the UN urged an end to the violent crackdown and restoration of internet access. Activists report over 544 deaths and thousands detained amid escalating violence.

title: WPL 2026: Grace Harris blitz powers RCB to nine-wicket win over UP Warriorz
content: Royal Challengers Bengaluru achieved a commanding nine-wicket win against UP Warriorz. An explosive opening partnership between Grace Harris and Smriti Mandhana powered RCB's chase. UP Warriorz posted 143 for 5, with Deepti Sharma and Deandra Dottin building a crucial partnership. RCB chased down the target swiftly, with Harris scoring a rapid fifty. This marks RCB's second consecutive win.

title: The Delta Force gap: Why China can't do a Maduro-type op — for now
content: US precision in Venezuela operation sparks debate on China's capabilities. Analysts highlight US advantage in integrated, all-domain operations, a fusion China lacks due to fragmented special forces and political control. While China boasts modern weaponry, replicating swift, surgical strikes against Taiwan remains a distant prospect, suggesting any attempt would be far more destructive.

title: Vande Bharat sleeper fares out! Which route will it run on? Check price & features
content: Vande Bharat sleeper launch: Indian Railways is set to launch its first Vande Bharat sleeper train this month, with services beginning on the Howrah–Guwahati route and fares starting at around Rs 2,300.

title: Prashant Tamang’s funeral: Wife Martha Aley, daughter bid emotional goodbye
content: Indian Idol winner Prashant Tamang has passed away in Delhi due to a heart attack. His funeral in Darjeeling saw heartbreaking scenes as his wife and daughter bid a final farewell. The music industry and his hometown are in shock over the sudden loss of the beloved singer and actor, who also ventured into acting.

title: Netflix deal: Paramount sues Warner Bros; seeks disclosure on $82.7 billion deal
content: Paramount Skydance is escalating its battle for Warner Bros. Discovery by suing for greater disclosure on the proposed Netflix deal. The company also plans to nominate directors and launch a proxy contest, arguing its all-cash offer is superior and seeking shareholder approval for any cable asset separation.

title: 'Shared dreams': 2 years after divorce - Shikhar Dhawan announces engagement to Sophie Shine
content: Cricketer Shikhar Dhawan announced his engagement to long-time partner Sophie Shine, an Irish product consultant, via a joint Instagram post. The couple, who met in Dubai, shared their joy with fans, marking a new chapter after Dhawan's retirement from cricket and recent divorce. While wedding date speculation exists, no official announcement has been made.

title: 'ICC's existence is unnecessary': Ex-Pakistan cricketer's explosive attack on BCCI dominance
content: Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal has voiced strong criticism of the ICC, suggesting it's losing relevance due to perceived Indian board dominance. He questioned the council's impartiality, citing India's refusal to play in Pakistan as evidence of the ICC's lack of control. Ajmal believes many nations privately agree but fear speaking out.

title: Texas-sized turnaround has Houston rolling into playoffs
content: Two key wins and a sideline scuffle highlight a run to the playoffs that happened despite an 0-3 start.

title: Steelers aren't sweating playoff drought: 'We came here for what lies ahead'
content: As Pittsburgh aims to end playoff futility, how's the team approaching Monday's game (8:15 p.m. ET, ABC/ESPN)?

title: Falcons interview Harbaugh, who is vetting teams
content: The Falcons announced Monday that they have completed an interview with John Harbaugh for their head coaching job.

title: Koepka returning to PGA Tour, 3 stars could follow
content: Brooks Koepka is returning to the PGA Tour as part of a new Returning Member Program, which would also allow three other stars from LIV Golf to come back.

title: Sources: WNBA, WNBPA agree to moratorium
content: The WNBA and Women's National Basketball Players Association have reached an agreement on a moratorium for league business, sources said.

title: Irish's Freeman won't be charged after incident
content: Notre Dame football coach Marcus Freeman will not be charged after being accused of battery following an incident at his son's high school wrestling match on Jan. 3.

title: Last-place Blue Jackets fire Evason, hire Bowness
content: The Columbus Blue Jackets, last in the Metropolitan Division, have fired coach Dean Evason, the team announced Monday, and immediately hired Rick Bowness to replace him, president of hockey operations and general manager Don Waddell confirmed.

title: Raiola joins Oregon as Ducks await Moore's call
content: Former Nebraska quarterback Dylan Raiola announced Monday on social media that he has committed to sign with Oregon.

title: NASCAR restores 'Chase' championship format
content: NASCAR will return to a 10-race championship format that closely resembles the first iteration introduced 22 years ago.

title: Johnson not sorry for rant: 'I don't like' Packers
content: Bears coach Ben Johnson isn't apologizing for his reaction to Chicago beating the rival Packers in the NFC wild-card round.

content: Michigan was the first of the final six to fall. Will Nebraska, Vanderbilt, Arizona, Iowa State or Miami (Ohio) be next?

title: Alonso wasn't perfect, but sacking him ignores Madrid's real problems
content: Xabi Alonso's time in charge of Real Madrid is over, but his dismissal will hardly solve the numerous problems the club is combatting.

title: Seven reasons why the Bears are the NFL's comeback kings
content: Saturday's wild-card win over the Packers was the seventh time the Bears overcame a fourth-quarter deficit.

title: From Wrexham to Macclesfield, FA Cup reminded us why we love soccer
content: Thanks to Macclesfield causing one of the biggest upsets ever and Wrexham passing their Premier League test, the FA Cup third round really delivered.

content: From trade chatter in multiple cities to epic blowouts to a hole in the Olympic ice, hockey fans have lots to digest.

content: The national debate over transgender athlete participation will be heard by the U.S. Supreme Court. Here's what you need to know.

title: WNBA, WNBPA fail to reach new CBA at deadline
content: The WNBA and its players' union failed to agree to a new collective bargaining agreement or an extension of the previous one by Friday's 11:59 p.m. ET deadline.

title: 'Hungry for more': 49ers' petty posts at Eagles tops NFL wild-card trolls
content: The NFL wild-card round had its fair share of petty posts after big wins, led by the San Francisco 49ers.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: McConnell, Watson, Nurkic among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Court proceedings distorted, High Court orders removal of reels
content: high court orders removal of 102 social media links that misused live-streamed court proceedings . a division bench of chief justice Sanjeev Sachdeva and justice Vinay Saraf passed the direction while hearing a petition warning edited excerpts from open court hearings were being selectively circulated on YouTube and Instagram . the case will be heard again on march 24 .

title: VDG’s gun goes off accidentally, teen son dies
content:
.

JAMMU: The 16-year-old son of a Village Defence Guard (VDG) died after the latter’s gun went off accidentally at his home in Chatroo, in J&K’s Kishtwar district, late Saturday. Police said VDG Piary Lal, a resident of Chatroo’s Loidhar, had been cleaning his gun when a bullet was fired inadvertently, hitting his son Anuj Kumar, a class XI student. The teen died on the spot. On being informed, a police team reached the spot and seized the firearm, besides shifting the body to a nearby hospital for autopsy. Cops said inquest proceedings were underway to ascertain the circumstances leading to the firing, and further investigations were on. “After post-mortem and other legal formalities, the body was handed over to the family for last rites,” a policeman said.

End of Article

title: Trump Announces 25% Tariffs On Countries Doing Business With Iran
content: US President Donald Trump on Monday announced a 25 percent tariff on any country trading with Iran, ramping up pressure on Tehran over its violent crackdown on a wave of protests.

title: Meta Plans To Cut Around 10% Of Jobs In Reality Labs Division: Report
content: Meta plans to cut around 10% of the employees in its Reality Labs division who work on products including the metaverse, the New York Times reported on Monday, citing three people with knowledge of the discussions.

title: Iranians Tap Musk's Starlink To Skirt Internet Blackout: Report
content: Some Iranians are still using Elon Musk's Starlink satellite internet service despite a nationwide communications blackout, three people inside the country said, the latest example of Starlink being used to counter internet shutdowns in geopolitical

title: Venezuela Leader Nicolas Maduro's Bodyguard Gets Key Role In Cabinet
content: Venezuela's interim president Delcy Rodriguez on Monday added a former bodyguard of her ousted predecessor Nicolas Maduro to her cabinet in one of the first ministerial changes of her administration.

title: Delegation From Communist Party Of China Visits BJP Headquarters In Delhi
content: A delegation from the Communist Party of China, led by its iternational dpartment's vice minister Sun Haiyan, visited the BJP headquarters here on Monday.

title: Trump To Meet Venezuela Opposition Leader Machado On Thursday
content: US President Donald Trump will host Venezuelan opposition leader and Nobel Peace Prize laureate Maria Corina Machado on Thursday at the White House, a senior administration official told AFP.

title: 648 Killed In Iran Protest Amid Government Crackdown: Rights Group
content: A violent crackdown on a wave of protests in Iran has killed at least 648 people, a rights group said on Monday, as Iranian authorities sought to regain control of the streets with mass nationwide rallies.

title: 2,514 Civilian Deaths In Ukraine In 2025, Highest Since 2022: UN
content: United Nations monitors recorded more civilian deaths in Ukraine in 2025 than in any other year except 2022, as hostilities flared along the frontline and Russia expanded its use of long-range weapons, the UN's top rights body said Monday.

title: Germany Announces Visa-Free Transit For Indian Passport Holders
content: India and Germany on Monday unveiled measures to boost cooperation in areas of defence, trade, critical minerals and semiconductors.

title: "No One Can Separate Mumbai From Maharashtra": E Shinde On Thackerays' Charge
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, who had to yield the driving seat to ally BJP for the Mumbai civic polls, hit back at the Opposition today, declaring that no one can ever break Mumbai from Maharashtra.

title: Indian-Origin Astronomer Wins UK's Royal Astronomical Society Gold Medal
content: US-based astronomer Professor Shrinivas Kulkarni has been awarded the prestigious Gold Medal by the Royal Astronomical Society (RAS) in London for his "field-defining" discoveries in time-domain astronomy.

title: AI-Driven Errors Causing SIR Hardships: Mamata Bannerjee To Poll Body Chief
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee wrote to CEC Gyanesh Kumar again on Monday, claiming that AI-driven digitisation errors in the 2002 electoral rolls were causing widespread hardship to genuine voters during the SIR exercise in the state.

title: Maharashtra Poll Body Bars Advance Payment Under 'Ladki Bahin' Scheme During Poll Code
content: The State Election Commission on Monday barred the Maharashtra government from releasing the January instalment of the 'Ladki Bahin' scheme in advance, citing the enforcement of the model code of conduct for municipal elections.

title: Meta Names Ex-Trump Adviser Dina Powell McCormick As President
content: Facebook owner Meta has named Dina Powell McCormick, a former Trump administration adviser and longtime finance executive, as president and vice chairman of the tech giant.

title: Apple, Google Announce Multi-Year AI Deal For Gemini Models
content: Tech giants Apple and Google announced Monday a multi-year partnership that will see Apple's next-generation artificial intelligence features, including its Siri chatbot, powered by Google's Gemini technology.

title: "Cannot Accept Under Any Circumstance": Greenland On US Takeover
content: Greenland's government on Monday said it could not accept a US takeover of the Arctic island under "any circumstance", while stressing it would work to develop the island's defence under NATO.

title: Student Asks For Breakfast At Chhattisgarh Hostel, Gets Attacked By Servers
content: A breakfast request in a university mess hall has exploded into a chilling flashpoint over campus safety at Guru Ghasidas Central University, after a BTech student was allegedly chased and attacked with a knife in full view of other hostel residents.

title: "Will Be End Of NATO": EU Official On US Takeover Of Greenland
content: It would be the end of NATO if the U.S. took Greenland by force and European Union member states are under obligation to come to Denmark's assistance if it was faced with military aggression, the European Commissioner for Defence and Space said.

title: "Inclined" To Keep ExxonMobil Out Of Venezuela After CEO's Response: Trump
content: US President Donald Trump has said that he is "inclined" to keep ExxonMobil out of Venezuela after its top executive described conditions in the South American nation as "uninvestable".

title: EU Parliament Bans Iranian Diplomats, Representatives From Its Premises
content: The European Parliament has banned all Iranian diplomats and representatives from the assembly's premises over a deadly crackdown on protests in Iran, the body's president, Roberta Metsola, announced on Monday.

title: Supreme Court to examine immunity for CEC & ECs after PIL flags 'law unto itself' risk
content: a bench of 'Lok Prahari' issued notices to the union govt and EC . "we will examine whether it is constitutionally permissible to give such immunity," the bench said . a law gives lifelong immunity to the Chief Election Commissioner and election commissioners from civil and criminal prosecution .

title: Punjab police claims cracking ex-sarpanch murder case
content: Jharmal Singh, a former sarpanch, was allegedly killed after being shot from point-blank range at a wedding venue in Amritsar

title: Presence of WB Govt and police officials during Mamata’s intervention of ED raid an ‘illegal act’, claims BJP
content: On January 8, West Bengal Chief Secretary and Kolkata Police Commissioner were present during the raids along with Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee

title: Omar Abdullah rebuffs BJP demand to set up National Law University in Jammu instead of Kashmir
content: The BJP demand is the latest in its campaign in Jammu after seeking cancellation of the MBBS selection list, which had 42 Muslims out of 50, at the Shri Mata Vaishno Devi Institute of Medical Excellence

title: Kashmiri Pandit leader Bhushan Bazaz, 91, an advocate of Hindu-Muslim unity, passes away in New Delhi
content: Bhushan Bazaz, son of popular Kashmiri writer Prem Nath Bazaz, was known for his efforts to establish peace in J&K through non-violent means

title: Himachal Govt sacks 11 cops for involvement in drug trade
content: “No one is above the law, and those who will promote the illegal trade of ‘chitta’ and other illegal drugs won’t be spared,” said CM Sukhvinder Sukhu

title: Concerns raised over continuing gaps in SIR process
content: People’s representatives seek steps to address issues related to SIR draft list, change of polling booths, and enrolment of new voters

title: In a first, Rajasthan panchayat gets certified for going fully organic
content: The panchayat took measures not only to resolve issues of soil degradation and declining groundwater level but also to address health concerns linked to chemical-based farming

title: Lucknow medical college staff seek FIR over vandalism, threaten to stall all OPD services
content: A scuffle broke out on the campus on January 9 when about 100 people, including BJP leader and vice-chairperson of the Uttar Pradesh Women’s Commission Aparna Yadav, allegedly tried to force their way into the Vice-Chancellor’s office

title: Medical college doctors defer their strike plans by a week following talks with govt.
content: The doctors had announced on Monday morning that academic activities in all government medical colleges across Kerala would grind to a halt from Tuesday

title: Row over CM’s mega quiz rages on
content: Organisations affiliated to the Opposition demand that it be withdrawn, citing political agenda behind holding the programme and that it would push the students to more hardship

title: China Communist Party team meets BJP leaders
content: The delegation will also meet a RSS delegation; meetings come after thaw in India-China ties in 2024, with Beijing resuming the Kailash Mansarovar Yatra and the reinstatement of direct flights between the two countries

title: Ex-refugee takes over as UNHCR chief
content: A former Iraqi president, Barham Salih, 65, became the first former head of state to run the United Nations High Commission for Refugees (UNHCR) at the start of the year

title: Supreme Court names new trial judge for coal scam cases
content: Incumbent Special CBI Judge Sanjay Bansal was to officiate from April 8, 2025, onwards for a period of six months only

title: Russia claims Oreshnik missile hit Ukrainian aviation plant
content: Moscow said it fired the Oreshnik in response to its allegations that Ukraine attempted to hit one of President Vladimir Putin’s residences in a drone strike

title: Police conduct raids, destroy arenas to prevent rooster fights
content: Drones are being used to check illegal activities in remote villages and stern action will be taken against those who violate the orders, say police

title: India, Germany to simplify defence trade: PM Modi

title: Non-application of mind, ‘copy-paste’ order led to detention under NSA: Wangchuk in Supreme Court
content: Application of mind by the detaining authority should be independent of the material provided to it by the authorities proposing it, the climate activist’s counsel Kapil Sibal argues in the court

title: New South Wales University to open Bengaluru campus in August, at Manyata Tech Park
content: The University of New South Wales, one of Australia’s leading universities, will open its campus in Bengaluru at Manyata Tech Park in August, 2026

title: Reopening of Kamaraj Road brings relief, but commuters fear fresh traffic chaos on M.G. Road
content: Kamaraj Road was fully reopened on January 2, 2026, restoring the two-way traffic between Cubbon Road and MG Road.

content: Ravi Naidu says the calendar will provide advance clarity on competitions and training programmes, enabling sportspersons to plan systematically and boosting sports development across Andhra Pradesh

content: The petitioner points out to the court that recently Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar has given a statement to the media that the government is identifying land for constructing a new building for the High Court

content: “This project, instead of de-clogging and de-congesting the city by developing five townships on the Bangalore-Mysore corridor has clogged and congested the High Court and other courts,” the Court observed.

title: HIV infections among Kerala youth increasing at an alarming rate, says Veena George
content: New cases of HIV among those in the 15-24 year age group, which was 9% in 2022, had risen to 14.2% in 2024. This figure was 15.4% between April and October in 2025

content: CM Bhajan Lal Sharma says the State government had taken strict action against paper leaks in the recruitment examinations, pointing out that no such incident had occurred in the last two years

title: Demand for separate Secunderabad Municipal Corporation ‘lacks merit and logic’: officials
content: Secunderabad does not function as a self-sustaining economic unit, and carving out a civic body would result in higher per-capita service delivery costs, officials told the Chief Minister

title: Jones won't fight, McGregor will and more 2026 MMA predictions
content: MMA is arguably the most unpredictable sport, because scheduling is based on wins and losses, so no prognostication is too far out . the widespread expectation going into 2026 is that Jones will absolutely make his return to MMA . he will end his short retirement in hopes of fighting at the white house this summer .

title: Orioles to debut Tupac Shakur bobblehead against Athletics
content: a prominent figure on the west coast rap scene, the legendary rapper moved to Baltimore from the Bronx in 1985 . he went to middle school and high school in Baltimore before moving to Marin City, Calif. in 1988 . on may 8th, we're celebrating the life and legacy of legendary rapper and actor Tupac Shakur .

title: Ranking the best players in the college football transfer portal
content: the offseason transfer portal window for college football players opens at midnight ET on Jan. 2 . there's no spring transfer period this year, so teams have one big chance to get their rosters right for 2026 . here are ESPN's rankings of the top players in the portal .

title: The 10 teams that have gotten off to the hottest portal starts
content: college football's offseason transfer window opened one week ago . a dozen FBS programs have secured commitments from 20 or more players in the portal . there are 10 programs off to impressive starts in building up their rosters for 2026 .

title: Declare 2 Nirav aides proclaimed offenders: CBI
content:
.

MUMBAI: CBI moved the special court Monday with a plea to declare two key aides of fugitive businessman Nirav Modi proclaimed offenders in a fraud case related to Punjab National Bank. The court adjourned the matter for arguments. The application sought a proclamation under Section 84 (proclamation for person absconding) of BNSS against Sandeep Mistry, director of one of Nirav Modi's companies in Hong Kong, and Mihir Bhansali, associated with Nirav's business activities. Both have been missing from the proceedings for a protracted period.

End of Article

title: Frozen waterfall, heli-skiing in Gulmarg, help Kashmir bring back tourists
content: the frozen waterfall at Drung was among several destinations closed after the Pahalgam terror attack last year . it reopened in Nov and has seen a steady revival in tourist activity . a tourist from Maharashtra is staying at a hotel and visiting nearby locations .

title: Boy among 3 dead, 7 missing in Arki market fire
content: the blaze broke out around 2:45 am in an old wooden residential building housing eight migrant families from Nepal and one from Bihar . eyewitnesses say the fire spread rapidly to over 10 nearby shops and buildings following a series of LPG cylinder explosions .

title: Probe religious discrimination in AMU: Ex-VC of Urdu university
content: former chancellor of u.s. university has written to union education minister . he alleges religious discrimination, administrative apathy and institutional failure . in his letter, he flagged the case of a widowed professor of political science .

title: Delhi HC clears Zydus biosimilar, boosting access to affordable cancer care
content: A business journalist with around two decades of experience tracking key consumer-focussed sectors like consumer durables, retail, consumer goods, aviation, automobiles and advertising, as well as economic ministries of the Union government. Now, writes primarily on pharmaceuticals and healthcare, and on issues of consumer interest. Besides also looks at trends that are shaping consumer behaviour and the broad consumer landscape. \nYou can follow Rupali on Twitter@Rupalijee. Read More

title: CFP National Championship first look: Previewing Miami-Indiana
content: 136 teams hope to taste postseason glory . a champion will be crowned in a matchup . the team will face off at 7:30 p.m. ET on january 19 . it's the first time the team has won the title game in 2025 .

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: What to know about every team
content: the new AP top 25 women's college basketball poll is out . the rankings are out for the second time since the calendar turned to 2026 . a slew of upsets over the past week left just three undefeated teams .

title: WNBA CBA Q&A: Nneka Ogwumike, Napheesa Collier on 'standstill'
content: the WNBA CBA is scheduled to expire at 11:59 p.m. ET on friday . the league and its players union will likely enter into a stage of "status quo" a work stoppage or lockout can be declared without notice . sources say negotiations have netted minimal progress .

title: What's next for LaFleur, Brian Gutekunst after the Packers' wild-card loss?
content: the last time the Packers did anything with the contracts of coach Matt LaFleur and general manager Brian Gutekunst, it happened in relative secrecy . the news did not leak out until just before training camp in July that year . it was never clear why then-team president Mark Murphy tried to keep it a secret .

title: Punjab gangsters who killed kabaddi player nabbed near Howrah station
content: alias Rana Balachauria was killed on Dec 15 while a tournament was going on . the accused were identified as Karan Pathak, Tarandeep Singh and Akashdeep Singh . police said two of them were sharpshooters and one was an informer .

title: Niners defeat defending champs for NFC wild-card win
content: the 49ers won 12 games despite playing most of the season without defensive end and linebacker . they had withstood the repeated injuries to some of their brightest stars . despite that devastating injury to another team leader and captain, they continued to battle .

title: Drake Maye carries Patriots to wild-card win over Chargers
content: the new England Patriots beat the Chargers 16-3 in the wild-card round of the playoffs . the Patriots will face the winner of Monday's game between the no. 4 Pittsburgh Steelers and no. 5 Houston Texans .

title: With no manager, Man United sink to new lows
content: manchester united have seen some low ebbs in the 13 years since Ferguson retired . the 2025-26 campaign will take its place after Brighton ensured any chance of silverware has been extinguished by early January . 12 candidates to replace Ruben Amorim - the inside story of why man united sacked Ruben amorim.

content: a 16-team college football playoff format will begin as soon as 2026, sources say . there's still a stalemate between the two powerbrokers . the deadline for completing the format moved from Dec. 1 to Jan. 23, 2026 .

title: Overreactions from five wild-card games: The Patriots still haven't beat a good team?

title: PMO likely to move to Sewa Teerth complex in next one week
content: the new office will be operational any time between Jan 14 (Makar Sankranti) and Jan 23 (Subhas Chandra Bose Jayanti) this will be the first time since independence when the PMO moves out of the seat of power at south block built by British architect Herbert Baker .

title: TMC claims 58L voters removed from rolls, SC seeks EC response

title: Trump posts fake Wiki profile calling him 'acting president' of Venezuela
content: he posted a fake Wikipedia profile calling him 'acting president' of Venezuela . he mocked the besieged country, the united nations, and the global community . some analysts say he is trolling the world and the world .

title: India, Germany to boost ties in defence, trade, critical tech
content: PM Modi hosted german Chancellor Friedrich Merz for bilateral talks in Ahmedabad . eight other announcements meant to ramp up cooperation in areas ranging from people-to-people contact to indian passport-holders through Germany . modi said both sides will work on a roadmap to enhance cooperation between their defence industries .

title: It's your duty to end 'slave mindset', PM tells Gen Z
content: the PM's laudatory words for Gen Z came against the backdrop of opposition netas seeking to coopt them in their agitation against the Modi govt NEW DELHI . he said no country can develop without self-confidence and told the largely young audience it is their responsibility to end the "slave mindset" that afflicted a generation of Indians due to the education policy of Thomas Macaulay .

title: Sympathy for accused cannot override the law, rules SC
content: a young man from UP will lose his govt job because of its adverse order over his not declaring a criminal case against him at the time of recruitment . a bench of justices quashed the order of Allahabad HC which held that the non-disclosure was of "trivial nature" the bench said that sympathy cannot supplant the law .

title: Bangladesh: Hindu politician dies in custody; family alleges denial of medical care
content: proloy Chaki, 60, died in police custody in a blast case linked to the 2024 anti-discrimination student movement that led to sheikh Hasina's ouster as PM . his family accuse the prison administration of denying necessary medical care to the musician and rubbishing police's claim that it was a "natural death"

title: ED goes to Supreme Court, seeks CBI probe against Didi for 17 offences
content: ED has accused the CM and top police brass of committing 17 offences under BNS, including robbery, dacoity, theft, assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharging his duty . the incident is unprecedented, unprecedented and extraordinary, ED says .

title: PSLV fails for 2nd time in 9 months; 3rd-stage glitch costs 16 satellites
content: Isro's workhorse PSLV suffered a glitch in its solid-propellant third stage (PS3), costing 16 satellites and an ambitious project of strategic, diplomatic and commercial importance . this is also the first time PSLV has failed consecutively . the main satellite was EOS-N1 (Anvesha), a DRDO satellite designed to give India's military sharper eyes in space .

title: Maharashtra SEC stops election-eve 'special gift' from Fadnavis
content: state election commissioner Dinesh Waghmare has barred the advance payment for the month of Jan . the state will only be allowed to dispense the sum of Rs 1,500 for Dec to around 2.5 crore eligible women in the state by Jan 14 . "the regular benefits of the scheme can be given while the model code of conduct is in force," he said .

title: The usual suspects? Same 6 testify as MP government witnesses in multiple cases
content: 'omnipresent' police witnesses were repeatedly cited as govt witnesses in hundreds of cases registered at laur and Naigadhi police stations in the district . the pattern of a few selected names recurring case after case emerged from FIRs accessed through crime & criminal tracking network & systems .

title: Isro sees warning in two consecutive PSLV failures
content: Chethan Kumar is a Senior Assistant Editor with the Times of India. Aside from specialising in Space & Science, he has reported extensively on varied topics, with special focus on defence, policy and data stories. He has covered multiple elections, too. As a young democracy grows out of adolescence, Chethan feels, there are reels of tales emerging which need to be captured. To do this, he alternates between the mundane goings-on of the Common Man and the wonder-filled worlds of scientists and scamsters, politicians and soldiers. In a career spanning nearly 18 years, he has reported from multiple datelines — Houston, Florida, Kochi, Hyderabad, Chennai, Sriharikota (AP), NH-1 (J&K Highway), New Delhi, Ahmedabad, Raichur, Bhatkal, Mysuru, Chamarajanagar, to name a few —  but is based out of Bengaluru, India’s science capital that also hosts the ISRO HQ. Read More
